DOC.brief_summary: Recently, the investigators study group showed in a mono center study that Point of Care (POC) based hemotherapy may reduce transfusion rates of allogenic blood products in perioperative care of coagulopathic cardiac surgery patients. The investigators aim to verify the obtained results by conducting this multicenter study.
DOC.brief_title: Point-of-Care Testing in Coagulopathic Patients Undergoing Cardiac Surgery - a Multicenter Study
DOC.criteria: Step 1: Patients scheduled for elective, complex cardiothoracic surgery (combined coronary artery bypass graft and valve surgery, double or triple valve procedures, aortic surgery or redo surgery) with cardiopulmonary bypass (CPB) Step 2: diffuse bleeding after heparin reversal following extracorporeal circulation or intra or postoperative blood loss exceeding 250 ml/h or 50 ml/10 min Pregnancy
